definition: Achyranthes bidentata (root used in Chinese medicine)
surname Niu
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
old variant of 膝[xi1]
knee
hyssop (Hyssopus officinalis)

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the thermosensitivity effect of achyranthes aspera on cervical cancer cells.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察土牛膝液对宫颈癌热敏感性的影响。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE:To enrich and purify Achyranthes Bidentata Saponins with macroporous adsorptive resins.
sentences.chinese: 目的应用大孔吸附树脂富集纯化牛膝总皂苷。

sentences.english: To purify the house he is to take two birds and some cedar wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop.
sentences.chinese: 要为洁净房子取两只鸟和香柏木，朱红色线并牛膝草。

sentences.english: And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.
sentences.chinese: 要为洁净房子取两只鸟和香柏木，朱红色线并牛膝草。

sentences.english: Objective To optimize the processing technology of Radix Achyranthis Bidentatae prepared with salt.
sentences.chinese: 目的筛选盐炙怀牛膝的最佳炮制工艺。

sentences.english: Objective To search a new planting method for improving the production of Radix Achyranthis Bidentatae.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索提高牛膝商品产量的种植管理新方法。

sentences.english: Objective To establish a TLC identification method of compound eupatorium syrup, and to set up quality control standard for the product.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立复方土牛膝糖浆的薄层鉴别方法。

sentences.english: Put the veal shank on the risotto and add the sauce. Serve hot.
sentences.chinese: 最后将焗好的牛膝放于意大利饭上，趁热上桌。

sentences.english: Objective To optimize the technology of processing Radix cyathulae.
sentences.chinese: 目的优选川牛膝的酒炙工艺。

definition: chuanxiong rhizome
common water plantain (Alisma plantago-aquatica)/water plantain rhizome (used in TCM)
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
red nut sedge (Cyperus rotundus)
Epimedium, genus of herbaceous flowering plant, cultivated in the Far East as aphrodisiac/also called barrenwort or horny goatweed (said to resemble crushed goat's testicles)
golden eye-grass (Curculigo orchioides)/Curculigo rhizome (used in TCM)
Notopterygium root (root of Notopterygium incisum)
Angelica sinensis
dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds used in medicine)
Salvia miltiorrhiza
the root bark of the peony tree
Manchurian wild ginger (family Asarum)
dried ginger
the rhizome of large-headed atractylodes (Atractylodes macrocephaia)
root of herbaceous peony (Paeonia lactiflora), used in TCM
Chinese thorowax (Bupleurum chinense)/root of Chinese thorowax (used in TCM)
